        public static com.google.common.io.BaseEncoding getHEX()

      • bigIntegerToBytes

        public static byte[] bigIntegerToBytes(java.math.BigInteger $receiver,
                                       int numBytes)

        The regular BigInteger.toByteArray includes the sign bit of the number and might result in an extra byte addition. This method removes this extra byte.

        Assuming only positive numbers, it's possible to discriminate if an extra byte is added by checking if the first element of the array is 0 (0000_0000). Due to the minimal representation provided by BigInteger, it means that the bit sign is the least significant bit 0000_0000 . Otherwise the representation is not minimal. For example, if the sign bit is 0000_0000, then the representation is not minimal due to the rightmost zero.

        Parameters:
        numBytes - the desired size of the resulting byte array
        See Also:
        BigInteger.toByteArray

      • reverseBytes

        public static byte[] reverseBytes(byte[] $receiver)

        Returns a copy of the given byte array in reverse order.

      • revert

        public static byte[] revert(int $receiver)

        Returns an array of bytes with the underlying data used to represent an integer in the reverse form. This is useful for endianess switches, meaning that if you give this function a big-endian integer it will return it's little-endian bytes.

        Returns:
        The array of bytes that represent this value in the reverse format.

      • revert

        public static byte[] revert(short $receiver)

        Same operation as in the revertInteger function, but in this case for a short (2 bytes) value.

        Returns:
        The array of bytes that represent this value in the reverse format.

      • revert

        public static byte[] revert(long $receiver)

        Same operation as in the revertInteger function, but in this case for a long (8 bytes) value.

        Returns:
        The array of bytes that represent this value in the reverse format.
